Reviews.Title: “Great location maybe too central!”
Reviews.Author: elle88England
Reviews.Content: Staff were nice and friendly, room was big and comfy, stand in shower was nice except our massage settlings didnt work. You could hear everything out on the street and the walls were really thin. So at times things got a bit noisy especially over the weekend. However it really was close to some main attractions was easy walk to the palace.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Location with clean spacious rooms - Would highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: s123002
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was phenomenal. Within a walking distance of less than 20 minutes to all the major historical sights and museums and great restaurants. We had a quad room on the 6th floor and the room was spacious with a large bathroom and a huge balcony. The staff, especially, the English-speaking ones - Daniel and Maria were very helpful and always ready to provide tips and going out of their way to find the right restaurants etc. We are vegetarians so that was a big help. All in all, would highly recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Clarkey8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2012. Excellent central location right next to Sol. Very handy for exploring Madrid. Rooms and bathroom good, although there is some delivery noise in the morning. Breakfast was ok, although things started to run out near the end of the breakfast period. Try the tapas bar next door, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Puerta del Sol, very convenient location. The safety box did not work the first night, and the front desk staff said he would arrange for the maintenance guy to fix it the next day (which he did!). Only thing is that the rooms looks a bit dated, bed was a bit hard and when we asked for extra pillows, I had to wait in the room for over an hour for them to bring it up.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: kitty83London
Reviews.Content: Located ight next to Sol Metro station. Staff are incredibly helpful and speak very good English. We arrived much earlier than we were due to check in and we were still given our room early. They provide you with a password for free Wi-fi. Bathroom is amazing, great shower and rooms very clean with air conditioning. Beware it is noisy as you are in the centre of everything but we didn't mind this so much as there was a large group of us and we were there to enjoy the nightlife. In all a fantastic hotel in a great location which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortably small rooms and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: AK266
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a pedestrian cobblestone road, so it's not accessible by car. Our taxi dropped us off at the main road and instructed us to walk a few mins down this promenade. We pulled two heavy suitcases each, past street performers and gypsies in our faces, begging for money. Being on the street is great during your stay.. but getting your luggage here is a nightmare!The hotel is not clearly marked - and to make things more confusing, there is a Petit Palace on every street corner. We overshot the hotel and stepped into "Petit Palace Arenal" by mistake. We left and pulled our luggage back to the Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol. The quadruple room we booked was unavailable. The woman offered 2 double rooms instead. We insisted that the 4 guests remain together after flying 17 hours to meet. After all, we paid for a quadruple, and she would not price adjust for 2 doubles. She called Petit Palace Arenal to confirm they had an available quadruple room there. So again, we pulled our luggage right back to Arenal. There, we discovered that the room would not be ready for 2 hours! After travelling across the world, this runaround was ridiculous. We returned to Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol and accepted whatever room was immediately available. We needed sleep! The double room was TINY. There was only room for two adjacent twin beds, and barely space to walk around it (picture posted). Upon sitting on the mattress, I became itchy and developed red bumps. We immediately called our travel agent for help relocating to another hotel. The front desk was notified of our early departure while we were still on the phone w/ the travel agent. Seconds later, the front desk woman was pounding on our door... demanding that we leave at once!!! She refused to let us continue our phone call to make other accommodations, claiming that she would be unable to resell the room if we stayed another minute. She stood at the doorway as we collected our belongings and ushered us out of the hotel. We were left stranded in Spain, with no accommodations and no local phone to arrange lodging. We never heard an apology. In fact, they somehow made US feel guilty for inconveniencing the front desk when in reality, they could not provide the service for which we paid. Rather than making a scene at the front desk, we quietly attempted to arrange alternate accommodations. In retrospect, we should have given her a piece of our minds. Worst travel experience ever. On a happier note - we loved the hotel we switched to: Petit Palace Tres Cruces.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fabulous welcome”
Reviews.Author: Wee_monsieur
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late and were expecting to be charged extra for this - just the opposite! we got a good deal and a great room - not at all noisy. Breakfasts are a feast! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modest hotel, but very clean and central located”
Reviews.Author: psnsilva
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel (3 stars) but the room was very clean and confortable. They provide free Wi-Fi and LCD TV. Dispite the triple room is a bit small, the beds are very confortable, the room was clean, the bathroom is big and weel equiped. We went to a meeting and the room was just to sleep there, so was perfect. The location is perfect, 1 minuto to the metro station. Probably I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple clean two star economy hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DonMacP
Reviews.Content: Although I was not impressed in any way by this hotel it did offer some advantages and was comfortable plus the reception was excellent. Arriving in Madrid late evening we wanted a hotel in the central area close to restaurants and clubs. No question that this hotel fits that bill perfectly. Secondly, being central it was important not to have the noise factor from traffic and again this hotel is perfect since it is situated on a pedestrian only street. having made the reservation only the same day the hotel had not received any record but the gentleman on the reception offered to let me use his PC and open my mail to show him the confirmation and price prepaid. He then said in return the hotel would offer free breakfast and he would get us a large room. The room turned out to be on the top floor with only a skylight but then for a one night stay during which we were out at clubs until 5am we were not particularly interested in the view! The room was large but that was because it was a family room with twin beds and a set of bunk beds. The bathroom was clean and functional as was the room. For then price paid (90 UK pounds) it was a good deal in our view and we were able to leave luggage all day with the front desk. Normally I would have stayed in the Intercontinental or a similar 5 star hotel as I do like the luxury but in this case the key factor was that all 5 star hotels in central Madrid would eithre require quite a walk or a taxi to get to the night club areas.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok but what about the rest?”
Reviews.Author: London-Sirjona
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very well located and the bedroom is nicely designed... having said that, this is like sharing the room with the street and the next bedrooms. Its very noisy and quite expensive in regards to the poor quality of the hotel. The reception looks very poor even if the stuff was friendly. will not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good located in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Magico79
Reviews.Content: Very good located modern hotel with free wifi. Breakfast is very good. You have free laptop in the room, alarm clock with charger for iPhone, white LCD Tv. The design is very modern. I book this hotel next time again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyrat
Reviews.Content: Just before this we stayed in two very nice 2 star hotels that we MUCH cheaper & outshined this place. One of them was only a few blocks away but was about $60/night cheaper. Pros: The reception people were nice and helpful and most of them spoke a little English. Free internet usage at computers in lobby. Central location. A/C This was one of the only hotels in Spain in the last 10 yrs that seemed to have used some softener on their towels! Cons: Maybe it was just the room we had, but it did not seem well kept up. Our non-smoking room smelled of smoke. The shower door got stuck and then fell off while I was inside. Other little signs of neglect, that by themselves wouldn't be a big deal but added to the whole picture of needing to be upkept : dirty grout, water stain on ceiling, patched chip in the shower, unpatched holes where the pipes went in/out. We also got unlucky in that there was construction on the Cortes Ingles store next door that went until 2am. And an all night protest in the plaza that we could hear in our room. So it was a little loud. Like all Spanish beds in hotels, the mattress was very hard & not to my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysider70
Reviews.Content: Petit Palace Puerta Del Sol is a typical central city hotel. Well located, standard rooms, good breakfast and competitive prices. It was clean and modern, while the staff were helpful when we asked for some local information. We read reviews about street noise, but didn't find that it bothered us when sleeping. Why though, does a hotel install see- through glass bathroom doors? I prefer some privacy when sitting on the toilet. Despite this, we would stay again for the great location and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: princess2011_11
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is very well situated, the room is very small, the beds are very hard, and the bathroom/shower extremely uncomfortable. The shower was very small and showering was an ordeal as everything got wet due the poorly constructed shower. At night the noise was sometimes unbearable. The staff was helpful and friendly, but the hotel is far from being a three star hotel. Please note that we were confirmed to Calle Arenal 14, and were rerouted to Petit Palace Puerta del Sol which was a much lower quality. Don't book through Hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Small dark and depressing.”
Reviews.Author: outdoor21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our Spain tour and were disappointed by the hotel. We had booked it based on the recommendations on trip advisor and the lonely planet guide. The hotel was in a great location close to all the major tourist activities and the staff at the front desk were excellent. It ended there! The hotel was noisy based on the location, which is fine, however there was a lot of noise at 2am when all the hotel dump bins were emptied! The hotel had very dark halls and the rooms were exceptionally small, you could not have your suitcases out, as there was no room to move. The bathrooms were clean but small, however the shower was brilliant. I cant say i felt overly secure in the hotel there was always strange characters in the foyer at night hanging out with the nightshift staff when we came in. The overall feel of the hotel was not great and i didn't feel comfortable leaving any valuables in the hotel safe. The daytime hotel staff were however excellent booked our activities for the bulls for us and when we returned had the tickets ready for the afternoon. They were fluent in English and were very helpful in regards to transport when the metro strikes were on. The staff were the highlight of the hotel but that is about all! I would not recommend this hotel i think based on our travels there are better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Slap bang in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: ChrisThompson30
Reviews.Content: We took the Metro from the airport, it is cheap, clean and cool, provided your happy to walk up and down steps it is the best way to travel around the city. The hotel is right next to Burger King (not noisy though!). Booking in was quick and easy. We had a room on the 3rd floor which had a small balcony and overlooked the shopping street below. Our room had air con and when we shut the window you couldn't hear the partying below. Our friends stayed in the next room and said it was noisy (not sure their balcony door was as well sealed as ours!). Overall we had 3 rooms but only one with a Laptop. My wife and I had iphones and they gave us the codes for wifi. There is also a PC in reception you can surf the internet with. Breakfast was fine, usual continental breakfast and we had bacon, scrambled eggs, toast and small sausages. The hotel is clean but the finishing of the rooms could be better. Hotel is excellently positioned within a short walk to all the sites. We would recommend the San Miguel Market and the streets surrounding for bars and restaurants. We also took the Metro to Reterio park which is massive and took us a while to find our way back out. Very clean and beautiful though, well worth a stroll round. On the whole there are things that could be improved upon but it was excellent for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “High Tech was right.”
Reviews.Author: MBostic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful we stayed in one of the biggest rooms on the top floor with a stunning view, and it included a laptop for our use. The balcony was spacious and wood was beautiful with a view of the city's night life down below on the street. Only thing I didn't like was that the king size bed was a bit uncomfortable, the bunk beds where much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very scary experience”
Reviews.Author: ShaunOxford_UK
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted my wife and I, our son and his girl friend (both early twenties). We stay in two double rooms on the 5th and 2nd floor. On the second night we where woken up by someone shouting my sons girl friends name outside our door. The person kept asking in broken english for us to open the door. I asked why he was knocking on the door at 1:45 in the morning. He just kept telling us to open the door. I told him I would not open the door until I knew what it was about. He then spoke to someone else on a mobile phone and said he had airline tickets. I told him that we had out tickets and would not open the door. I then told him I was ringing security. He kept asking for us to open the door. No on answered from the front desk. When they did, they said they would send someone up to check the corridor. This did not happen. As you can image we did not sleep, worried he would return. What really scared us was the fact that the only way the person could have got my sons girlfriends name was from someone on the hotel staff. The following day there was no record of call to the front desk in the night and no record of the incident outside our room. This whole experience ruined our whole holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and dark-avoid room 505”
Reviews.Author: Georgette H
Reviews.Content: We were only here one night but were very disappointed with the accommodations. We (my husband and 22 year old daughter) had just stayed at another Hi-Tech Hotel in Seville and enjoyed our stay there. This was not as nice. Our room was very dark and looked nothing like the pictures shown on Trip Advisor. The only window was a skylight but the shade was drawn to hide the office building that looked into the room. There was no laptop in the room - something the notice in the elevator said came in all rooms. When we inquired about this, they said it was not the case but we could use the computers in the lobby - one of which was broken. Our television carried only 3 channels and the furnishings were very worn, chipped and meeger. Some lights did not work. The room was downright depressing - I thought one step up from a hostel but my daughter thought it wasn't quite that bad.

Reviews.Title: “good location,modern and comfortable hotel.Area is noisy though.”
Reviews.Author: mahin
Reviews.Content: Booked through booking .com.price was reasonable.Right in the area of porta del sole.Shopping,restaurants and sightseeing were all very close.Rooms were comfortable and modern.receptionist was extremely helpfull and always responded to every thing we wanted.Lobby was relaxing and we could bring our drinks there.The only issue was the night time noise from the street mainly on week end.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small”
Reviews.Author: smithcaIreland
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, very small rooms , staff not helpful and tried to charge us for 2 breakfasts that we didn't have, Also tried to charge us for phonecalls we didn't make!!! We booked a smoking room but when we got there they said there was none available and that was more or less it , I have to say I kicked up a fuss and eventually we got moved to a smoking room the next day, Rooms very small and very warm at night, We weren't keen on the bathroom, As High Tech as they were there was no lock on the bathroom door and it was glass so you could see righthrough, Not very private... The only thing this hotel has going is the location, other than that I'd book a different hotel the next time I'd visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of madrid”
Reviews.Author: suz!p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a busy pedestrian shopping street, an easy walk to all the main squares, royal palace, flea market and restaurants. It is clean and modern but hardly palatial. We paid a reasonable price and were very happy with what we had - as we were not expecting the Ritz but on almost every street there is a 'petit palace' all created from interesting old buildings but modernised inside with standard fittings - but keeping lots of details and adapting to the quirky shapes of some rooms, they are done well and are in great positions (like being in covent garden - including the noise and street entertainers) just pick the one with the best price. Had a great time there, busy fun city, lots of culture, bars, restaurants etc - and don't miss the sunday flea market (the biggest in europe) before you go

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: sktravelbug88
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal from the hotel website a few days before I checked in. The location was excellent! A few steps (literally) from the Sol Metro stop. Shopping, restaurants right outside. I guess that is good and bad since our room faced one of the shopping streets and at 2am the dump trucks came by and started collecting the trash. It was really noisy for about an hr. That sucked. But otherwise, it's a good place to stay and I would stay there again. We stayed only one night, our last night in Madrid. We stayed at another Petit Palace location (Tres Cruces) the other nights, which I liked better than this one. The rooms aren't the largest I've seen, but they are not NYC size either. There were 3 of us in the room. Beds were ok. Clean, simple. Great shower - one of the highlights!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: dmdped
Reviews.Content: Great location, BUT No air conditioner. It was impossible to sleep due to the heat. It was dirty. The beds are too hard. It is a shame.Only one person ( a very nice woman) at the front desk, and apparently in all the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: mlp2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, but I would not recommend this hotel. It is billed as a 'high-tech' hotel, which I guess refers to the funky bathroom and the plasma TVs in the rooms. However, the room was very uncomfortable. We could not control the temperature and it was very warm and dry in the room. We stayed 2 nights and told them after the first night to see if they could fix it but they couldn't (or didn't). Also, we were on a non smoking floor, but workers were in the hallway smoking. Bathroom was very strange, yes, it did have the cool shower with the massage features, but it wasn't all it was cracked up to be. Also, who wants to watch their friend use the bathroom??

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NancyGail
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were given a room that was awful. The room was so small that the luggage rack could not be opened. We were placed in a smoking room after requesting non-smoking. The Air conditioning had been turned off as of October 31 for the season and the temperature was in the 70's in Madrid and the room was boiling. The window opened up to an enclosed court yard that housed garbage cans at the base. People from their apartemnts could see into the room as the building was less than 20 feet away form the next building. My husband and I checked out immediatly. I will say that Hotels.com did refund our money and were fairly easy to deal with in regards to a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: meaghs
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was a bit cold in atmosphere- the young reception staff seemed put off by the idea of helping anyone. The room was cold and stark- and although the website claims that one amenitiy that comes with the rooms are balconies- this was untrue. Our room did not have a balcony. One of the reasons we decided to go with this hotel was for a room with a balcony- and we even asked specifically at booking whether it was true that every room had one- and they said it was. Oh, and this 'High Tech" hotel had 2 computers in the lobby- while we were there only one was working and even that one computer would go down ocassionally. We were there on our honeymoon and were unhappy. We could have paid less for a superior room elsewhere in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: KC_94105
Reviews.Content: Location is great. The hotel is in the heart of all the shopping action and close to El Corte Ingles (large dept store with supermarket on lower level). We actually stayed here on two occasions in March 2006. BOTH time, they were not able to provide us with the room type we booked. We had booked their "high tech" room which is suppose to include a PC with internet access, bicycle (exercise bike), and trouser press (iron & stand) IN the room. We booked the rooms 2-3 weeks in advance of arrival and made the reservations on their own website. When we arrived, they gave us a room but did not mention that it was NOT a "high tech" room. Only when I asked ("does our room have a computer..."), did they check the reservation and then they told us "sorry there is no high tech room available. You can have room ### for tonight and then switch rooms..." Considering we were only staying 3 nights during our first stay and 2 nights on our second stay, this was unacceptable. I did not want to have to unpack and then re-pack to switch rooms. They tried to offer us breakfast (we declined) and a room facing the main street (big mistake because it is SO LOUD, especially on the weekends). I told them I only wanted the room we booked, nothing more. I insisted they provide us with a computer in our room and gave up on the bicycle and trouser press (we didn't care about those anyway). The location is what prevents me from just giving this place 1 star. I would just advise anyone considering this hotel to double check with the staff when you check-in to make sure you are getting what you booked. p.s. when we checked out on our second stay the manager asked how our stay was and I told her our problems. She claims she was "unaware" of the issues (interesting... since she was there when we first checked in and even instructed the staff to bring a laptop to our room).

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good: Friendly staff Location- close to the subway and tons of shopping Easy to find Clean Nice elevator Large rooms Good & clean beds Plasma TV! Bad: Paper walls (as others posted) you really can hear everything in the halls! Privacy- I don't know anyone who wants a glass door to the bathroom, combined with the mirrors at all angles in the room, you roommate can see you (if they try hard enough) whether you're taking a shower, at the sink, or on the toilet. eww Only two computers- I appreciate the free internet more than anyone. But, this is a busy hotel so there was almost always a line for the computers Only one other thing, I am sure they had no control over it, but for our entire stay, there was no phone service.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: ArthurNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Rooms are institutional in apperance, with black furniture and black celings. Size of rooms was fine. Hot woter was EXTREMELY hot to the point that it fed back into the cold water supply. We had to call the front desk to find out why we couldn't get cold water. We were told to run the cold water in both the shower and the sink until we got cold water. After several minutes we finally got cold water. We wasted a lot of water in a country that's in a drought emergency. When we suggested they reduce the hot water temperature the front desk ignored us completely. Not at all impressed with personnel as they were most uncooperative and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not great ...”
Reviews.Author: Ninsen
Reviews.Content: We will never be returning to this hotel again! Although the hotel is centrally located, and the rooms well priced - it was definitely not enough to offset the fact that we couldn't enjoy one nights rest the entire weekend. The walls were so thin, that you could hear everything outside your door! At about 6 in the morning, we were awoken by thunderous snoring from an inebriated hotel guest who was locked outside his room. He had decided to sleep in the corridor. We had to wake him and tell him to please sleep in his room or sleep in the lobby as his snoring was so loud, it was keeping us awake! Then at 9.30 the cleaners arrived and started cleaning rooms adjacent to ours. The symphony of noise created by hard wooden floors, loud animated conversation and vacum cleaners, ensured that no lie in was possible. Although annoyed with such lack of sleep, we thought that it was sheer bad luck, and perhaps the next night would be better. At about 5 the next morning, we were awoken by drunken shouting and laughter from a group of inebriated hotel guests right outside our door. Again, we had to object at such inconsiderate behaviour although we feel that this may not have been such a problem had the walls been better insulated!! In summary, you would expect some measure of independence and privacy from other hotel guests. This was simply not possible here ... not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Palace Puerto De Sol in August this year (2005) and absolutely loved it. The location is ideal, right in the heart of Madrid. It's just a short walk to shopping areas and Placa Mayor (Main square), which is a perfect place for a summer dinner. This hotel offers FREE internet access, as opposed to 6 Euro per hour. The staff were the friendliest hotel staff that we came accross throughout our entire European holiday. They are young, happy and know what they are talking about. They speak excellent English. If you're after a renovated, clean, friendly hotel, in the heart of Madrid, this is the one to choose...and the price is also great! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to the metro station, shops, restaurants, with a wonderful staff, and a great rate $$ and free internet. Will recomend it to my friends and will stay here on my next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned hotel with free internet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on one of the main streets of Madrid, with plenty of places to eat and shop in just outside the front door, and a metro station just across the road. Rooms were a bit small, but this could be forgiven in view of new and tasteful furnishings kept spotlessly clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. The lift was a bit small and didn't work at times, which was fine for backpackers like myself, but a bit annoying for those with big heavy suitcases. The bathroom was nice and large, with a super swanky shower boasting multiple jets so you can have a back massage while you shower! However, as the bathroom door was made entirely of see-through glass, this could be a problem for travellers who desire a bit more privacy - we had to cover our door with some tape and plenty of paper in order to overcome this problem! The piece de resistance was that this hotel offered free internet, both in the lobby, and for those carrying their own laptop computers around, you can get free internet access in your room as well if you have the right cables. All in all, an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Trendy Hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: dusk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location very central, we stayed for two nights at the end of August. Athought very modern and trendy – dark ceilings, spot lights, plasma TV and lots of mirrors – it was very small, I think the mirrors helped to create more space. The bathroom isn't very private so you can see each other on the toilet, so you have to be very good friends :-). The shower was brilliant thought. The room was clean and very nice and so was the reception area – great free internet too! We had a rate that included breakfast which was excellent, would recommend it. We paid £58 inclusive of breakfast on Easyhotels. My only criticism would be that the workmanship of the room wasn't great as the hotel was just referebed this year and it was very small, this is why it only got a above average, otherwise would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but why oh why paper thin walls....”
Reviews.Author: plod
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have got a much higher rating from me but for its paper thin walls. You would swear that someone in the room next door was actually in your room. Even normal conversations could be heard through the wall as well as TV. People in the corridor felt like they were in your room. Luckily our neighbours were decent quite people who didn't stay up later than us. I myself must apologise for my mobile which rang at 7am (don't you love relatives who can't understand time zones), which no doubt woke up everyone on the whole floor. Positives - good central location, very close to Metro - internet LAN cable in room - good TV and cable - helpful staff with left luggage facilities - good air-con (unlike other reviewer, or room had good thermostat) Negatives - Paper thin walls - A lot of construction noise as well from outside or in hotel at about 8am onwards - The chambermaid did a rush job when cleaning room during the day. It was OK, but not as good as other Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money for the superb central location”
Reviews.Author: diplomaticdingo
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel as what you get for what you pay is pretty good; the location is superb! (We got a good deal); breakfast provided a good variety of food; free internet was handy; the shower's power was pretty good and well, better than Claridges in London for sheer coverage and pressure!!! We (my sister and I) had asked for a front view room and paid for such in our reservation (booked directly with the hotel) and were given a back room. We then registered our objection in my bad spanish and were promptly given a front view room with a little balcony on the 4th floor. Was slightly noisy with the windows open, but the airconditioning is excellent and there is obviously glazing enough to shut out the noise when the windows are closed. We slept well the both nights we stayed there. I would recommend this hotel as good value for money for the excellent central location - everything is on your doorstep or a short bus/metro ride or a pleasant walk away (eg Prado etc). The style is very modern and clean lines - which I kind of prefer to the British traditional floral/chintzy stuff in hotels, but noticed it appeared to have been done on the cheap in some bits (the bathroom fittings - depends on the location of your toilette in the bathroom!). Still, I have stayed in heaps of 2,3,4,and 5 star hotels for work and leisure, but when it comes to value for money for a quick weekend getaway, this is really a very nice, comfortable, friendly, centrally located little hotel with very co-operative English speaking staff. So would recommend it. Will store your bags for you for free if your flight leaves later in the day. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticScot
Reviews.Content: Can not get more central than this, little noise from outside but some work going on in Hotel at time of our stay, noise started 7.30am appeared nearly finished however. Room comfortable & clean, shower enjoyable, mini bar contains no alcohol but soft drinks free. Booked through Expedia where room facilities were said to include DVD player and hotel a bar, no sign of either of these. Breakfast 11 euros pp but so many restaurants nearby cheaper could be found, McDonalds, KFC and Burger King included if your Spanish not up to much. Open top tourist buses stop nearby, good for an over view of city, hop on hop off as you wish. All in all an enjoyable mini break.

Reviews.Title: “A More Accurate Review”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFoodieVA
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from this Hotel. We stayed here based upon the outstanding reviews written here. We had a good experience, and WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN, but would avoid it if you have children (even with a quad room). The quad rooms are the same as any room except that they put a bunk bed in it. We feel that the reviews do not tell the whole picture, and we want to provide other travelers with a bit more insight on this location. The value is outstanding and difficult to match [excellent]. The location [excellent] is clearly ideal if you want to be in the center of town and metro and 2 blocks from Plaza Mayor etc., (which we did). The noise level is understated in these reviews. There was construction from 7am to 9pm, and the windows do not seal well enough to block it out effectively (if you push on the window it blocked out most of the street noise). There was also contruction and welding next door and underneath this hotel and the odor of welding permeated throughout. The rooms are CLEAN, but there were several odds and ends that needed repair (sink countertop was not attached, some loose mouldings, dripping air conditioner vent above the door, etc.) The rooms are definitely compact [ok for a two adults, but add a child or two and it doesn't work]. Small fridge in the room is nice. The rooms have no drawers to store your clothes, only three shelves in the closet, and the closet is quite small to begin with. Air conditioner adjustment is difficult, it's not an actual thermostat, so the room was either an ice box or an oven. Elevator fits 2 people with bags, snuggly. VERY rickety, it slams open, and it did not work at all on 2 occasions [difficult for us since we were on the 4th floor and had a baby carraige to carry down 4 flights]. Buffet is not included depending on the rate you pay, and it's 11 Euros if you pay for it directly [not even closely worth that price]. Highly recommend you opt for the lower room rate and forego the buffet considering all of the terrific food and values right outside the door of the hotel. The showers are nice, but I don't know what the rave is about the shower heads, these are not hydro showers, there are merely 4 small horizontal heads at house pressure. A nice touch is the lighting. Lots of reading lights on the bed, and 4way controls let you turn room lights off from the wall or either side of the bed. Free high speed internet access in the room was wonderful, we brought our laptop and emailed family pictures everyday. Majority of the front desk staff are friendly and accommodating. They do not stock too many ammenities though. This all being said, we would easily stay here again, but not with kids unless they were in a separate room. Ideal for a couple. or group of college kids in a quad room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brats
Reviews.Content: Arrived 18th March for 2 nights after 23hrs travelling,we were pleasantly surprised with the room and bathroom.The kids had a room for three with a set of bunks and ensuit room with a King fantastic bathroom plus a laptop and free internet. Great location walking distance to all the major sights Breakfasts were very good lots of choices Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be more central - about one minute walk from the official centre of not just Madrid, but the whole of Spain. It's on bus routes, has a subway stop across the road and is on the tour-bus routes. All around are the sights you'll want to be seeing - walking distance to most, lots of shops, restaurants, bars.... I could go on. The hotel itself is less than a year old, modern, clean with all the mod cons. The staff are friendly & willing to offer suggestions, give help, etc. We didn't breakfast eat in the hotel, so can't comment on that. Oh... and the shower, it deserves a paragraph all to itself - fantastic!!! Little things were - the single beds - I don't get that, but know it's common in continental Europe; the air-conditioning didn't work - for the locals, the wonderfully warm weather may only seem like the start of Spring, but for us it was WARM. There was an air-conditioning unit in the room - it just didn't do anything. These were small things, and easily over-looked when the hotel itself & location (and that shower) are taken into account. We also got a price of €82 per night, which also make this an easy hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: cf9371
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid at the end of January on a business trip for 7 days and 6 nights. After doing some research on-line I chose to stay at this hotel, so I took the chance and booked it! I was very impressed. It is a small ultra modern boutique hotel right smack in the middle of one of the hippest parts of Madrid. The rooms are very nice and comfortable with a high speed pc on a desk with a flat panel monitor (High Tech rooms). The bathrooms are very spacious and the shower is incredible. Mini bar in rooms stocked with water and sodas is included in price. Although the hotel doesn't have a bar or restaurant, you will find everything in a short walking distance. The metro is also just steps away, you see it right from the doorway of the hotel. I recommend this hotel, and I will stay here when I go back. Staff friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Shower!”
Reviews.Author: sunshines
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Petit Palace Puerto del Sol for three nights I would recommend it to young people who want to be at the heart of all the action. The bedroom was clean and well appointed although the fact that there was a mirror on the ceiling and not above the dressing table was rather peculiar. The air conditioning unit was not working and even though it was winter the room reached stifling temperatures during the evening. Unfortunately since our room faced onto the main street opening the windows meant putting up with a lot of noise from late night revellers! The bathroom was bright, clean and spacious with an excellent shower, however the fact that the door was made of glass (with a frosted panel) was slightly off-putting. The breakfast buffet was above average for the price with a good selection of fresh fruit, cold meats, cheeses and pastries. All in all this hotel was excellent value for money; clean and modern with a friendly, helpful staff team.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very centric and new for the price with free internet access!! Angry staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent above average hotel for the budget conscious traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Puerta del Sol for 5 days in October for our first ever visit to Madrid. The hotel was recently refurnished and had a special room + breakfast package for 79 Euro. It is situated right in the heart of the city centre (Puerta del Sol) where we were able to experience both tourist and local dining and music. The area is older but shops are more dense, and 1 min from the metro and minimal stops to other newer/posh areas where hotel rates were quite high. The hotel itself is new with only 6 floors and although the furnishing finish is not exceptional (eg they used laminate floors instead of wood) it's good enough for a short stay for a 3 star hotel! The shower has a waterdrop showerhead as well as 4 body showerhead so it was like a standing spa. The buffet breakfast was also reasonably good with a good selection of fruits, dessert and cured meats/eggs/sausage. There is internet access in the dining room or free in-room broadband access. We also noticed a number of other hi-tech chains within 5 min walk at much higher prices. Would recommend this hotel to those whose main aim is to see the city but also retire comfortably at the end of the day. WARNING - do NOT make international calls from the hotel, a 4.5 minute call to australia cost us 28 Euro!!! Update - I have just found out they have raised their opening special for the month of october!
